body_html:
If you only have python3 installed on your system, python and pip will use python3 and pip3 respectively. To add to all of these, you can even install more versions of python, and access them using python3.4 or python3.5 or python3.6.
All of these possibilities are omitted from the docs for simplicity.
In most users cases, there is only one version of python installed, so the instructions will work.
For users with multiple python versions installed, we trust users to correctly access their desired python installation.

All of these possibilities are omitted from the docs for simplicity.

For users with multiple python versions installed, we trust users to correctly access their desired python installation.
body:
If you only have python3 installed on your system, `python` and `pip` will use `python3` and `pip3` respectively. To add to all of these, you can even install more versions of python, and access them using `python3.4` or `python3.5` or `python3.6`.
All of these possibilities are omitted from the docs for simplicity.
In most users cases, there is only one version of python installed, so the instructions will work.
For users with multiple python versions installed, we trust users to correctly access their desired python installation.
